alert.note: Alert for Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 05 at 6:57PM CST until March 06 at 2:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Wisconsin, including the following county, Manitowoc. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. Some basement flooding is also possible this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 656 PM CST, Local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Two Creeks, Two Rivers, Mishicot, Larrabee, Cooperstown, Maple Grove, Francis Creek, Hickory Grove, Maribel, Kellnersville, Melnik, Reifs Mills, Fisherville, Rosecrans, Zander, Taus and Menchalville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
